Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: rounding numbers for the sake of conversation, with 20 participants and 7 required to sign there's a 66% likelihood on each notarization that you will *not* be one of the signers 😛

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: ...or perhaps specify that the notary block finder is given priority in such a way that under normal conditions (perhaps a one minute pay window) the finder would also be the notarizer?

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: why should miners be notaries?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
@Lumbi if you're on about testnet, more than 90% of blocks are found by 
e) none of the above

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: to be clear I am referring to the notary miner that is given preferred mining conditions. it seems it would be a bit more intuitive and not advantage faster notaries as the emphasis among notaries would be on distributed security and not speed (once a block is found).

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: in mainnet, PoW is PoW afaik

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: one could argue the relative difference of NN(A) using 5GHz and NN(B) using 3.9GHz; however, even at the "low diff" of NNs, there's a nominal speed difference at that high of a degree of precision

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: if we assume all the notaries have sufficient fastness, perhaps randomness could be added to the code so that of the 64 notaries they are chosen randomly and over time equality of notarizations would be achieved regardless of  the speed of the hardware ?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: PoW is, in and of itself, exactly what you're asking for 🤷🏽

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: fwiw, to add code that "randomly" picks one of the 64 would make it *less* random (not to mention that it would really piss off non-NN miners)

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: or when one notary finds a block a second random process is initiated that determines finally which notary notarizes (without hardware advantage, more of a PoS random function that should ultimately lead to equality in numbers of notarizations among the 64 over time).

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: Either way, you're forcing the outcome and making it *less random* and *more centralized*

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: libertarian naysaying is a well known *ad infinitum* 😉

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: as is saying "you're wrong" to people that are wrong.....

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: it's a purity spiral

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: if taken to the extreme

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: Hello Guys, I have another question

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: I have been following the configuration guide for the notary node. I am now in the final steps, but when I have to import the private key a doubt comes to my head. Where shoud I look for the private key?

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: I cannot find the BTCDwif key and the BTCwif key

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: Perhaps should I extract them from iguana? Maybe it is not explained in the guide?

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: Thanks in advance

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: For testnet you can create an Komodo address and get the private key (WIF key)

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: read the testnet setup instructionns here https://github.com/Alrighttt/2019NNtestnet/blob/master/README.md

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: mainnet is different and needs more secure setup

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: And in mainnet, how do I should obtain BTCDwif  and BTCwif  keys to be imported?

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: I mean, shoud I create a BTC and BTCD wallets on the server?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: KMD wif = BTCD wif

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
for mainnet you should write down 24 words seed phrase in a piece of paper and store it somewhere safe. input that phrase into your notary node by typing (when creating the `wp` file). follow the insctructions for mainnet. when you execute the `./wp` file that will display your BTC WIF, KMD WIF, Pubkkey etc. to use. import those WIF keys into coin daemons.

another way to obtain WIF key is to use Decker's script and use the `compressed` address, key and pubkey https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/wiki/How-to-Generate-Address-and-Private-Key-(WIF)-for-3rd-Party-Coins-Using-Passphrase

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: Decker's script is needed for all 3rd party coins that has different format address and private key

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: It seems that this is not explained in the tutorial or I am not getting it, sorry. Where should I create the ./wp file and what should be the format of the command line to add the 24 words phrase?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
```
curl --url "http://127.0.0.1:7778" --data "{\"agent\":\"bitcoinrpc\",\"method\":\"encryptwallet\",\"passphrase\":\"insert very secure password here\"}"
```

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: passphrase = 24 words seed phrase?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: yes

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: `\"passphrase\":\"insert very secure password here\"`

Author: almoche#6700
Content: @SHossain Hi, I‘m almoche. Still setting up my server

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you need to change `insert very secure password here` with your 24 words

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: the mainnet guide is slightly outdated and will be updated in due time. please follow the testnet guide from Alright's repo and participate in testnet if you are interested.

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: ok, the problem is that I created a random password not in the 24 words format. Now I have a right output with the keys

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: thanks

Author: MadCryptoHead#3559
Content: According your recommendations I am going to continue my tests in the testnet

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: wp_7776 file contains `walletpassphrase` call. which to be used if you use encryptwallet. not sure if these calls are active or not. this came from early version of the guide that Kolo created and I never found an issue following the guide. however, there were few modifications in the setup guide by some members and ops and the guide got messed up a bit.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: the original guide stated to copy `btc`, `kmd` file and change the port to 7776 and raname `wp` file to `wp_7776` and change port to 7776

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: someone changed that part of the guide.
